name: Linux and Bash
description: Here at Learn to Cloud, we like to get hands-on as soon as possible. So, we've prepared a Capture The Flag (CTF) lab for you to practice your Linux and Bash. Before you can access them, you'll spend time learning about the lab and setting it up. Don't worry – along the way, we'll provide tips, documentation links, resources, and more to help you succeed.
short_description: Master Linux command line, Bash scripting, Git version control, and Infrastructure as Code basics through hands-on CTF challenges.
prerequisites: Mac OS or an Ubuntu based computer. If you're on Windows, you'll use WSL.
Join the Learn to Cloud Discord - Here you can ask questions, just make sure to ask in the right phase channel.

capstone.title: Linux CTF Lab
capstone.summary: Deploy the Linux CTF lab and complete 18 progressive challenges to validate your command line skills in a real cloud environment.
includes: Practice troubleshooting, permissions, and basic networking

hands_on_verification.summary: Submit proof of your GitHub setup and CTF completion.
includes: Create a GitHub Profile README repository
Submit your Linux CTF completion token

requirements.name: Wrote a Developer Profile README
requirements.description: Demonstrates that the learner can write a clear, structured README that communicates their skills and goals.

requirements.name: Forked the Linux CTFs Repo
requirements.description: Demonstrates that the learner understands forking, can create a fork, and can contribute to shared or open-source codebases.

requirements.name: Completed Linux CTFs
requirements.description: Demonstrates that the learner can complete Linux command-line CTFs and verify completion with a token.
